intro: Acourtia vanillosma, commonly known as the vanilla acourtia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its small, yellow flowers are often overlooked, but they play a vital role in pollination by attracting various insects. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
